C E F G H I L M N O P R S T W

O

optimizeDesiredOutputsForClassificationProblem(NeuronBehavior) - Method in class com.dkriesel.snipe.training.TrainingSampleLesson
If teaching classification problems you should consider placing the binary values at -x and x, where x is the absolute location of the absolute maxima of the 2nd derivative of the activation function (LeCun - Efficient Backprop).
optimizeDesiredOutputsForClassificationProblem(NeuralNetwork) - Method in class com.dkriesel.snipe.training.TrainingSampleLesson
If teaching classification problems you should consider placing the binary values at -x and x, where x is the absolute location of the absolute maxima of the 2nd derivative of the activation function (LeCun - Efficient Backprop).
optimizeDesiredOutputsForClassificationProblem(double) - Method in class com.dkriesel.snipe.training.TrainingSampleLesson
If teaching classification problems you should consider placing the binary values at -x and x, where x is the absolute location of the absolute maxima of the 2nd derivative of the activation function (LeCun - Efficient Backprop).
optimizeInputsAlignCovariances(double) - Method in class com.dkriesel.snipe.training.TrainingSampleLesson
Scales the input components so that all of them have the same covariance in O(NUMBEROFSAMPLES*INPUTDIMENSIONALITY) It is strongly recommended to use optimizeInputsCancelMeans() before because this function expects the averages of each input component to be zero.
optimizeInputsCancelMeans() - Method in class com.dkriesel.snipe.training.TrainingSampleLesson
First calculates the average of each input component, then subtracts the resulting average vector from all input samples in O(NUMBEROFSAMPLES*INPUTDIMENSIONALITY).
